poem:
Title: "A Pinch in the Brew"

Salt in the tea,
so it stirs – a sour surprise,
lost between our nations.
An ocean of flavor-turned-tide,
In the scientist's revelation.
A berth, given by G7's grace
now rocked by a savory notion,
A taste, touched by strange alchemy – 
Our bond's unforeseen corrosion.
This, the cuppa's secret lore,
A dash discordance in the pour.
